column4: its justified.  I would have noticed my harddrive was failing alot sooner if it would have been more often
[1] bill: or within an hour or so if the smart notification let you know via gui
By the time I started getting errors I had lost half the harddisk.
the fsck errors started earlier, I just didn't really notice them
[1] bill: I'm sorry to hear about that. If your disk supported smart (and the vast majority do) it would have let you know very quickly
it does, and it was enabled =)
[1] bill: but no imnotify hook for it :(
my position is that we will catch 99.9% of the people before + lots of additional people if we switch over to nixing the scheduled fsck's and going to user-friendly SMART monitoring
it's an additional expense with little benefit because most users don't care about their data enough to even back it up to DVD
it's a great benefit to people who _do_ but those people will get RAID now if they want it
I will agree the smart monitoring needs to be better.
the stuff in the logs is rather cryptic I'm afraid
[1] bill: 99.9% of people don't read logs
I'm just trying to ferment my ideas here
well I mean, I saw a few smart messages on the console, but it couldn't tell me what they were saying.  It wasn't WARNING HARDDRIVE IN ANGER, it was, unknown msg or what not
I'm assuming they were smart messages, they could have been kernel messages. Its definately not obvious what they are.
